main.name: Francisco J. Mejias
main.bio: I never feel like I know enough. 7 years ago when I started working in QA I decided to also get a Masters in Internet Technology with a concentration in e-commerce. Right after I finished, I was assigned a project that involved building an Android and iOS app from the ground up. Overwhelmed with the amount of manual work, I started learning Swift on my own to create an automation framework for the iOS project. This then allowed me to work with the Espresso framework on the Android app and freed me enough to start learning web automation. After I became good enough with Java I joined the web-automation team, and I’ve been automating test cases ever since. However, I still wanted to learn more, so I completed a scholarship challenge from Udacity and I was awarded the chance to ear a nanodegree in Frontend development for free. Currently, I'm reading about brain plasticity and statistics, because the future of automated testing is the automation of it, and I believe neural networks are here to help. If I'm wrong about this, at least I'd have learned a bit about neural networks… and that’s already pretty cool to me! When I’m not working, you can find me playing soccer, training for a marathon, or walking my dog.

resume.skillmessage: Here is a list of the tools I use with enough propficiency to get things done

work.title: QA Automation Engineer
work.description: Android, iOS, and Web Automation GUI testing for Booker Software products using Selenium with Java for web, Espresso for Android, and XCTest framework with Swift for iOS. Other duties include training newly hired QA employees on how to use these frameworks, manual API testing, taking and saving database snapshots and creating backups of our automation database.

work.title: From Tech-Support to Senior QA Analyst
work.description: I started in Tech Support and worked my way to the chain. During this time period my main duties included troubleshooting production issues, writing/executing GUI/API tests on different web/mobile projects, business-requirement analysis, and a brief experience combining QA duties for the mobile team with scrum master duties.

education.description: I received a scholarship from Udacity and Google after competing on a 3 month challenge with about 10,000 other contestants. The nanodegree covered from web foundations, to writing web applications focused mainly on React.

education.degree: Master of Science in Information Technology
education.description: Program included programming in PHP and JavaScript, Cyber Defense and Threats, Cryptology, Biometrics, Security Design Principles, Web Security, Network and Device, Forensics, Cybersecurity Policy (legal, ethics and compliance), Cloud Computing, and Data Mining

testimonials.text: I have worked with Francisco for over two years and he is the most diligent QA analyst I've ever worked with. He is excellent at taking a user story and finding the best way to rigorously test the scenarios; be it with automation or manual testing. Francisco is well respected by his peers and has mentored several other QA analysts. I whole heartedly recommend him for any Mobile QA position.
testimonials.user: Gabe Giosia - Software Engineer at Google

testimonials.text: Francisco has great attention to detail and a skilled eye for design and good user experience. Beyond just finding defects, he focuses on improving the quality of the product by working closely with both developers and product managers. I have had the pleasure of working along side him and it has made me a better developer.
testimonials.user: Joe Bramhall - iOS Engineer at The New York Times

testimonials.text: Working with Francisco for the past two years has been a tremendous experience. He thinks of scenarios that I never even considered and his deep analysis to detail is beyond amazing. Working with Francisco has made me a better engineer and any team will be lucky to have him.
testimonials.user: Sage Ventour - API Engineer at Vimeo
